Notification¶

Contains functions primarily focused on the notification model.

cccenter.python.notification.get_notifications(user, get_all=False)¶

Gets notifications

Parameters:
  • user (models.User) – current user
  • get_all (boolean) – If set to true will get all the notifications, if set to false returns 5 most recent notifications
Returns:

All the user’s notifications or the 5 most recent
Return type:

[models.User]

Note

The return type is actually a query set, but can be treated as a list of User objects.

cccenter.python.notification.solved_cipher_notification(username, challenge_id)¶

Notifies the users when a challenge has been solved for the first time, all users of that challenge will receive a notification telling them the user who has solved the challenge and a link to that page

Parameters:
  • user (string) – username
  • challenge_id (int) – id of the challenge
cccenter.python.notification.unviewed_notifications(user)¶

Checks if there is any unviewed notifications for a user

Parameters:user (models.User) – Current user
Returns:True if there is more than one unviewed notification, else False meaning that the user has no unviewed notifications
Return type:boolean
cccenter.python.notification.viewed_notification(user, notification_id)¶

Sets a notification to viewed based on the user and notification_id

Parameters:
  • user (models.User) – Current user
  • notification_id (int) – id of the notification object
Returns:

Was the notification viewed parameter succesfully set to true
Return type:

boolean
